title: Bugs in the Trees in the Great Smoky Mountains: A Study | 2 of 2
question_text:
The hemlock woolly adelgid is a small invasive insect that came to North America via Japan and is responsible for killing most of the hemlock trees in the Great Smoky Mountains National Park. To try to control the destruction of hemlock trees caused by the hemlock woolly adelgid, biologists have released lady beetles from Japan (which are known to be natural predators of the hemlock woolly adelgid) onto several of the remaining healthy hemlock trees in the park.
Which of the following describes the experimental units in this study?

choices.text: Healthy hemlock trees in the park.
